text: this is Jimmy Wang for the New York
Times business seems to be running
smoothly at this Honda assembly plant in
Guangzhou but it isn't over the last
four months young Chinese workers
demanding higher wages have caused Honda
plants across the country to shut down
including this one
I caught up with Gao Feng Ming a 20 year
old worker in Honda's Foshan
transmission making plans
he says his contract was terminated
because of his participation in the
strike before the strike the company
promised to make us staff if we came to
work here but that changed after the
strike if we do anything that damages
the image of the company we don't
qualify to become staff our salary
increased but some departments also
raise their production requirements
everyone knows Honda is already one of
the world's top 500 companies so why
does it offer such low salary it's
because as Chinese are looked down upon
the Japanese staff make a minimum of
50,000 RMB a month simply by sitting in
an air-conditioned office we don't make
enough money the living cost keeps going
up and earning a hundred twenty bucks a
month I have to think twice even when
buying a bottle of water not to mention
other things some people have to live on
the money their families send during the
May holiday I didn't even have enough
money to go home it all started in the
assembly Department yes they also make
120 bucks a month away I don't get paid
for overtime they produced twice the
amount but still received the same
salary then on May 17th in the morning
the transmission assembly department
took the lead to strike several
companies in the Pearl River Delta in
southern China have decided to relocate
Foxconn technology the large electronics
manufacturer hit by a string of worker
suicides plans to move to another
Chinese province where it can continue
to pay lower wages this strategy may
work for a while but one thing is clear
the new generation of young Chinese are
increasingly outspoken and organized
about defending their rights food cost
60 bucks basically mobile phone is 15
bucks living necessities are 15 to 30
bucks
and cigarettes to smoke fifteen to
thirty bucks for cigs Internet is a must
even without a computer I use the
Internet
I don't have a girlfriend I've been
single for a year
I'd like one but my salary isn't enough
to support myself not to mention a
girlfriend I can't work here anymore
when I go back home I will see what
business I can do and do it
